name: TheAtlantic
text: The killing of a black man at the hands of the police in Minneapolis has stirred outrage. The latest Atlantic Daily from @mimbsy. https://t.co/wfZM1jzqjM

name: TheAtlantic
text: The interest Joe Biden has expressed in Susan Rice reflects his concerns that the ongoing economic and public-health crisis the U.S. faces may require him to pick a strong national-security hand as his running mate, @IsaacDovere reports. https://t.co/Ki2rtUDe9D

name: TheAtlantic
text: A new Netflix documentary about Jeffrey Epstein gives voice to the women who say the financier abused them. But it is strikingly unclear on Epstein himself, and on the circle of privilege that helped to protect him, @sophieGG writes. https://t.co/hm5CuZCePg

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Rioting is abhorrent. Trumpâ€™s incendiary call for illegal acts is more likely to fuel than stop itâ€“â€“especially if any police act on his irresponsible words," @conor64 writes. https://t.co/BTDj0dZQv3

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Doomsday planners canâ€™t conjure every possible future calamity. But their warnings can prompt the government to react quickly, to adapt to ambiguity, and to treat uncertainty as a feature of good social science," writes @marcambinder: https://t.co/HFrkZN6vDx

name: TheAtlantic
text: The economist Tyler Cowen believes that America's regulatory state failures are significantly hurting the response to the pandemic. "They are not small matters; they are major reasons America has confronted this crisis so poorly," he tells @conor64. https://t.co/JxUvD615QS
